question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: Firstly I would want to save money so I would try to find an airlines booking center or try to find it online as everything is sold there. Then I would try to find cheap ones and airport fliers that are close to my travelings, it would save time and effort to do so for the adventure of middle earth. I would like to think I am tight on money, so I would favor the airlines that are affordable and cheap with their travels. I think that if the feedback from the airports are bad, I would try to find a good airlines or a better service that is more sustainable in its matter for the cause, I would do so immediately. I want to save money in the long run, so I think that the best way to save money on tickets is the most efficient in its matter and you can save money.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: I book an airline ticket by first doing some research on Google to see which airlines are offering the best deals on flights for my particular date range. This means that I will set up parameters for my search by running the city of departure and the city of arrival, the dates of my trip, and the time when I want to travel. I then review the results that Google provides and choose carriers that I think will give me the most value for my purchase. I value my budget just as much as I value my comfort when I am flying. This means that when I'm booking an airline ticket, my goal is to find an airline that will maximize my comfort in flight without breaking my bank. This can at times be a very hard balance to strike, as many airlines are trying to nickel-and-dime passengers more and more. Sometimes I will find an airline that has an amazing deal on tickets, but then I will realize that they're going to charge me $200 just to check my bags and that is a non-starter for me. After I've done my diligence on which airline will offer me the most amenities for the lowest price, I will look up the airline's contact number and will phone an agent. I will then provide my name and payment details to reserve my ticket.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: Booking an airline ticket is sometimes stressful because there are so many ways to do it. I always want to take advantage of reward points or airline miles as well so finding the best way to capitalize on those while booking a ticket is a priority for me. I will typically start with Google by entering my destination and "airline ticket" to the search query. This will usually pull up several good results as well as some useful sponsored results which is where the discounts and rewards are usually highlighted. Once I find a site that I trust I look for a list of airlines and start going through them by price as well as how much I like the airline. Some airlines I have had bad experiences on or just don't like the way they operate so I will avoid those if I can. Usually I am able to find a flight by Alaska airlines that I can earn reward points on or airline miles and I'll book that ticket through Alaska Air's website or through a third party like Priceline, whichever is offering the better reward.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: To book a flight, I first run an internet search regarding flight times, flight lengths, stop-overs, and pricing. Typically, I'll check at least 3 sites to compare pricing. Once I've narrowed it down to a few flights, I'll check the flight times as well as any layovers that are associated with each flight. I'll also make note of what airline it is as I don't want a discount flight with poor amenities or a poor in-flight experience, such as poor meals or limited in-flight entertainment. If I'm unable to find a flight that fits my budget and time constraints, I'll either check additional sites to see if there are more options with another booking website, or I'll review my most important desires for the flight and decide which ones I can make compromises on. For the most part, I want a flight that is reliable and reputable so that I feel confident that it will be as pleasant of a flight as possible and also that my luggage will arrive with me and not get lost.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: Booking an airline ticket can be frustrating and time consuming. But using the best possible website to book flight tickets can reduce some of the frustration and anxiety that can come with it. Evaluating different websites and comparing prices helps in determining which airlines has the best deals. It is also advisable to determine if one has frequent flyer miles and how those miles can converted into points that can used towards the purchase of those tickets. Once all those points are taken into consideration, it may be further advisable to evaluate the best possible way to use those miles. Booking tickets also takes into consideration the number of layovers or halts that would be included during that flight. It may also be wise to take into consideration the different destinations offered in terms of airports. Sometimes the cost of travel could be cheaper if some smaller airports are chosen over metro city airports. Other times, it may be more expensive to chose many layovers. So one should be aware of those factors when making the ticket reservations. To sum it up, the price, airports and the final destination must be taken into account.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: To book a flight, I first will type into Google the airport I'm flying out of and the airport I'm flying into. I will then scroll through the search results. My goal is to find a cheap flight that is also at a reasonable time and only has at maximum one layover.  If the flight is too early, or arrives too late at night, or there is more than one layover, then I will look for another flight.  I value not having to sleep overnight in an airport or have to be there super early in the morning.   Once I find a flight that fits these criteria, then I will choose the flight, I will choose the number of bags checked, I will then choose my seat and then I will confirm the purchase.  I also value not having to sit next to anyone, so may purchase a better seat option later on.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: First, you have to decide where it is you want to fly to. When you do, I would suggest doing your booking online rather than on the phone because I feel it is just easier to do online. Go to a website like Expedia or Travelocity and pick your destination to where you want to go, sometimes, a flight might be booked up on a particular date, in which case you're going to have to settle for another date or perhaps a different destination. You can usually save money on your flight if you're willing to deal with a layover as non-stop flights tend to be more expensive. You should definitely shop around before immediately picking a flight as you could potentially lose money booking a flight that is more expensive than necessary. After you decide on where you're going, put in your payment information, I would recommend a credit card with rewards so you can get bonus miles, and book your flight.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: To book an airline ticket first you must find a place that sells airline tickets. You can do so by searching online. Then you want to find a price that you really want as well a time that works for you. Then you might want to look into the individual airline for any issues that may occur like fees or restricted items. Also you want to know how early you must be there to get through security and make your flight on time. Also how long it takes to walk to your gate. You might want to search for airlines that let you see through the window or be in the aisle. One more thing you might want is to have a boarding pass that allows you to get on the flight first and off first or to have a higher class to sit closer to the front of the plane.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: Instant flight ticket booking is always a costly affair. Therefore the first step to how to book flights online is to make a travel plan beforehand. A minimum of 2-3 months prior planning is sufficient to get you the best price. Any tentative travel plans give a rough idea about the dates for travel. This helps to search the flights accordingly. One can also search according to the destination and take note of the flight prices. Having a flexible plan enables one to select those days when the flight tickets are less costly. As it is commonly seen that flight prices are relatively lesser in off seasons and weekdays as compared to peak season and weekends. Once you have chalked out your travel dates roughly, the second step in how to book flight tickets online is to compare the flights. You can choose the economy and fly on a budget airline. Or else you can choose a luxury one and travel in style. Comparing flights and their prices will show you the clear picture of how much which flight will cost on the day you select. And according to this and your planned itinerary you can select the flights. Select your flight. Double-check the date and timings. Enter the passenger details and coupon details if applicable. Then make the payment. Although E-Tickets are valid everywhere, it is still advisable to get a printout of your tickets. This is because of any unexpected situations which might come up.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: As a potential passenger, first I would check the prices for all of the different airlines, to see which one had the best value for the trip that I am wanting to take. I would pick a specific airline that I like, and then I would search online to see some of the reviews from others who had flown using this particular airline. If the reviews are good then I would proceed to contact the airline about booking my flight, but if the reviews are bad then I will change the airline and go to the next one that I like that has the same benefits. I would also check to make sure that it had good reviews, because I would never want to fly on an airplane if the airline did not have good reviews. If everything looks good, I will go ahead and book my flight for the date that I need.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: To book an airline ticket you must first decide which airport you would like to fly out of and what airport to fly into.  To do this a simple google search will work.  Make sure you turn on your location function on your computer.  Choose the closest airport to you to fly out of and the closest airport to where you want to land. Once you decide on your arrival and departure destinations you need to decide on the date of travel.  You can use a site such as expedia to book the actual ticket.  For example say you wanted to fly to Chicago from Washington on Saturday, you would plug in the relevant information into expedia and the site will show you the available flights.  It's possible that you will not find an acceptable flight.  In that case you may want to change either your departing airport or your arrival airport.  You could also try changing the date of your flight.  Once you find acceptable flight you simply click on the flight and enter the relevant information.  Be sure to pay attention to relevant cancellation policies as some flights are non-refundable.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: When I am looking to book an airline ticket, I try my best to save money by shopping around. There are quite a few websites that can search multiple airlines, multiple dates and helps to pick the optimal flight. Most of the time I go to google flights on kayak, and search for the destination flights. I pick a date, typically Wednesday of the week and select "plus or minus" three days to search around that date. I also select nearby airports to find best deals. I don't mind driving 30-45 minutes to another airport close by if that could save me hundreds of dollars, especially when the whole family is traveling. I like the feature on google flights that can show a bar graph with prices sorted by dates. After selecting the optimal airport, optimal dates, I look for flight duration as the next criteria. I prefer shorter flights and less number of stops. After getting the desired flight, I proceed to checkout. In the past I had come across an obstacle where the flight price will be higher when google diverts me to the airline site, but typically selecting another date solves that issue.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: To book an airline ticket, I first decide which method I want to use. I could book directly with the airline, either by phone, or online on their own website or a third-party site such as Booking.com. If booking by phone, it's relatively as simple as looking up their phone number, calling it and telling the agent where I want to go and what day and time. The only obstacle is there may be a long wait time until an agent is available. There is also a small chance that the agent could make a mistake and the severity of that depends on the nature of the mistake. Double check everything before ending the call to reduce the chance of errors. Booking online at the airline website entails finding the site, navigating to it on your computer, wading through their menu system until you find specific information for your destination, then choosing the desired flight day and time and navigating to the checkout/payment screen, entering all requested name, address and credit card information then finalizing the booking. Be very careful with all entered information and double-check for errors. There's always a very small chance of a mistake, but if you're very careful everything should go well. Booking a flight on a third-party website is similar and differs only somewhat from company to company. My main goal is always the the same; select the correct destination, day and date for the flight I want, and accurately enter all credit card information correctly.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: When looking to book an airline ticket I go to my familiar and favorite airline websites, spirit and frontier. I choose them because they are the cheapest and I have always travelled with them in the past. Then I look at expected dates of travel and compare the pricing and times available. If they have cheaper options on different dates and my dates are flexibile I will go with the cheaper option. From there I also look at how much checked baggage costs as well as carry-on options and pricing. Lastly, I want to choose my seats if my children are flying with me so I can ensure we are all sitting together. If I am traveling alone I do not care where I sit. After that I compare both airlines with all costs included and my decisions on which airline to book with and proceed with my airline ticket purchase.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: When booking a flight, it sometimes can feel overwhelming given all the options of airlines and destinations. When I have to book a flight somewhere, I first go to a web tool where I can compare prices and flight times for multiple airlines at one time that go to my desired destination. It is very easy to select the city you are in, the city you are trying to travel to, and what date range you are looking to fly. From there, the tracker will give you all your airline prices for the possible trips. Always remember to check the airlines for fee details, as sometimes you may think you are getting a good deal on the flight, but if you have to do things like check bags they can get you on hefty price increases. I always look for layovers too, as I much prefer to travel straight to my destination rather than stopping at other cities first. Once I decide on the best deal, I will then go direct to that airlines website or app, and follow their instructions to book my ticket.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: When I book airline tickets, I usually begin with a google search. I wish I could afford to shop by the quality of airline, but in practice my goal is usually just to find the cheapest way to fly wherever I'm going. I start by using Google Flights, and I plug in my departure and destination cities and the rough dates that I want to travel. Often there are a lot of different options to keep in mind, because slightly different dates can have big price differences, so while I'm googling I will have a notebook out and jot down the various options using that. My first priority is price, but the length of the trip also matters to me. Google flights will sometimes suggest ridiculous trips that have two layovers and take almost an entire 24 hours, so I avoid those and write down the flights with best prices that have reasonable times. Depending on my destination and how familiar I am with the airlines serving that route, I will also separately check the websites of some airlines I've used in the past, such as Norwegian Air for flights from the US to the UK, noting those in my notebook too. Once I've found the cheapest flight with a reasonable transit time, I will quickly go to the airline website and book it.

question: How do you book an airline ticket?
text: Like many things before the advent of the world wide web, booking a airline ticket used to be a difficult and time consuming affair. Fortunately the days of having to go out of your way to buy a plane ticket in person are long behind us. Booking a flight can be done in a matter of minutes with a smartphone and an airline app. When you've decided on your destination, a quick Google search will tell you which major airports are at your destination, and what airlines serve it. With this information in mind, you can buy your plane ticket with just a few taps and swipes on your chosen airline's app. Your boarding pass will even be emailed to you, so you'll have everything you need to board your flight on your phone. You'll still need to check in for your flight, usually 24 hours prior to takeoff, but this can also be done on the airline app. In most cases, you won't even have to interact with an agent at all.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: In order to stay connected with friends, I first make sure to follow them on social media. I also make sure I have their numbers saved. Then, I will usually like all of their posts, leave comments, and text them to hang out at least once a month. Because we live nearby, it's easy to plan dates and get together to hang out. If they don't respond to my efforts, then I will make one final push and then leave them alone. I usually pay attention to posts, texts and calls from myself and from them just to make sure I'm giving as much as I'm getting. I want to stay in contact with my friends and feel like I'm caught up on their lives. I want to have their support and friendship in all parts of my life. Furthermore, I want to continue to do the things we enjoy together.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text:
There are a variety of ways I stay connected with my friends. I use social media a lot and different platforms for different types and levels of communication with different friends. I'll use Facebook for more intimate or detailed conversations, especially the private messages, with pretty much any friend, but particularly those I've known longer or are less into social media. I use Instagram to view friends' more daily less serious leisure-related activities and usually have a quick chat consisting of a few short comments. I'll use Twitter to communicate with those who don't use Instagram or to see someone's thoughts, opinions, jokes, etc. and sometimes pictures, though both Facebook and Instagram are better and more frequently used for that purpose in my opinion. On rare occasion I'll visit a friend's YouTube channel although in my circles, YouTube is more frequently used for sharing [e- content created by others.
I will frequently contact my friends by text message, effectively daily talking to one friend or another, especially those I live close to or are close friends, often for meeting up and or just to have an enjoyable conversation. 
I will also use email frequently, especially when catching up with someone and events in their life, it's better than Facebook for more personal, intimate conversations. I'll also still occasionally use it to share funny or interesting articles, jokes, etc. though I generally prefer Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube for that.
Finally, I will call close, dear friends, including those I don't contact often and/or don't have a large social media presence by phone. I often do this on important days like holidays, birthdays, anniversaries and the like.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: When I graduated from college, I moved away and so did my friends. Although we are states apart (sometimes countries apart), we are still in touch and we continue to talk on the phone or social media. We are in touch because I sometimes need their advice, I plan a visit in the state they live, or just to see how their lives are. It is quite simple with today's accessibility to social media platforms. First, I add my friends on my professional online platforms for networking. Sometimes I create a project/group there and invite my friends to join. In some cases, I get an invite from my former colleagues to join their circle. Then, I start discussions in the forum. If anything is unclear, we resort to talking over the phone and have a lengthy conversation. In addition, before the COVID-19 pandemic, I used to travel quite a bit and whenever I visited different states or countries, I would shoot up a social media message or email to arrange a meeting. So far, I am happy with how I manage connections with friends using social media platforms.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: As someone who tends to be very busy, I start by making sure that I am following my friends on their social media pages.  Next, I make sure that I have these social media apps on my phone where they can be easily accessed.  Then, I make sure to check these apps to see what my friends have been up to whenever I have a few moments of down time.  If I see something interesting I will send my friend(s) a text message to either start a conversation or plan an event together.  Sometimes I can be very busy, but even still I make sure to reach out to my friends at least once a week just to show them that I am still interested in them.  Sometimes a simple text exchange is enough of a signal to a friend that you care about them, which is the basis for maintaining a lasting connection.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: I only keep a small circle of trusted friends that I stay connected with. I stay connected with them through my message application on my phone. I have a group message where me and my friends talk about our days, post memes, and generally let each other know what we are up to. Next, I make plans every Friday to meet up with my friends. We have a weekly poker game in which we drink beer, talk about what's going on in our lives, and smoke cigars. With the covid-19 pandemic currently disrupting our lives, we have only been able to meet up about once a month. This is a big obstacle but I know after the pandemic subsides we will go back to normal. I really value our friendship. Lastly, to my other friends that are geographically far, I've been known to send care packages just to know that I am thinking about them.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: Despite not being able to travel or gather in large groups because of the current pandemic, I stay connected with my friends in a variety of ways. First, I log in to Discord on my desktop or my phone. Then, I check to see if any of my friends are currently online. If they are, and sometimes even if they're not, I send a message asking how they're doing. I might chat with my friends for a bit through text and maybe voice chat if they want. From there, we usually end up watching anime or a movie together, or possibly playing Overwatch or another online multiplayer game. I enjoy getting a big group of friends together and playing a match with just people from that group. If people aren't available on Discord, I check the Twitter app on my phone to see what people have been up to recently. I might comment on people's posts or make some of my own to let my friends know how I'm doing. Occasionally, I might video chat using Zoom with my friends, but I'm kind of shy, so I prefer text and voice communication.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: Firstly, when I try to find a good way to connect with my friends and family, I try to ask Google or Siri because they know the answer to everything in the end. Then I would try to find other ways with different aspects such as vocal discord or online texting message based center of elliot carver. I think that because I am very busy and short of money, I like to keep it simple with online messaging or voice chat. I like to read reviews and if the service is bad, I like to find alternatives or other means of communication. I like having ease of access and easy to use features so I want to keep the best apps for communication. I like to save money on apps so maybe not a paid to subscription to use like Runescape, service no use. I like to think that internet access is the obstacle.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: In order to stay connected with friends, I would first keep this goal in mind that I shall leave some space in my hearts for my friends and be prepared to make efforts to it; second, I would spend time touching base with my friends, using texts, phone calls, or social media; third, I would be willing to share my stories to entertain my friends. I would love to exchange personal funny stories at work with my friends. The challenge would be find time to catch up with friends especially if you cannot see them in person or you are in different time zones, that would require you to make plans in advance considering the time differences. For me I would love to keep in touch with my friends, I would love to share my own stories and hear good news from them, I would also be willing to comfort them if they are having a bad day.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: My friendships are very meaningful to me, so I try to stay in touch with my friends as best I can. For starters, I always make sure to stay in touch with my friends via text. If a friend texts me, I make certain to text them back. If a friend hasn't texted me in a while, then I make sure to text them. In addition, I try to regularly meet up with my friends. Depending on the type of friend and how close we are, that could be meeting once a week or maybe just once a year. I just make sure to put in the effort to see them, and not wait for them to ask to see me. If I have difficulty getting in touch with a friend, and some time has gone by, I do go the extra mile to try and get in touch. I will touch base with one of their other friends or family members to make sure that everything is okay. My friendships are the most important relationships that I have, and I don't want to lose them. So I take steps to stay in touch, which shows them how important their relationships are to me.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: I stay connected to my friends by first setting up social media accounts and making sure I log in on a regular basis to keep tabs on what's happening in my friends' lives. Then I make sure that I reach out to friends whenever they post content about milestones like birthdays, engagements, weddings, new babies, and new jobs, so that I can express my congratulations. Moreover, I regularly invite my friends to my house as I regularly host dinner parties as a way to ensure that all my various friend groups make new connections with each other. I value making meaningful connections and it is my goal to make sure that every friend feels like I care about the big events that are happening in their lives. One obstacle to staying connected with friends is distance. It can be very hard to keep a relationship up with a friend if they've moved far away and are in a different time zone. Even though I can keep tabs on their social media, it is much more difficult to give them a call when they aren't in the same city and it is obviously even harder to spend time in person with them.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: As a friend, I actively exchange contact information with other friends that includes account identification and transmission medium, such as a phone number and WhatsApp. Then, I will add the information to my personal contacts database by either updating an entry for existing friends or creating a new entry for new friends. Then, as our relationship develops, I will maintain a list of interests and facts about my friends as I learn them. Then, I wait for an event to occur or a need to exist such that I am aware of a friend's connection and high probability of eager participation in communicative input, such as a question in a field close to their specialty or even a simple birthday. Because I prefer to communicate with a specific purpose, I keep the contact attempts to a minimum and I always make sure to have a list of talking points to prevent silent and awkward communication periods. If the individual continues to respond with positive enthusiasm and the contact methodology remains valid, then I will remain indefinitely in contact as the need arises. I prefer meaningful conversations and strong relationships, so I don't make the effort for individuals who do not demonstrate an interest in continued friendship.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: As a friend, I first figure out what the personality and likes are of the friend I am trying to stay in contact with. I then think, is my friend an artist? Is my friend a musician? Is my friend just a social butterfly and we don't really have any common hobbies? With each of these questions, my goal is to find out the best way to be relatable with my friend and to contact them. So if they're an artist, I will keep in touch with them through Instagram to talk about their art that they post. If my friend is a social butterfly and just likes to post memes or their life story on Facebook, then I will use Facebook Messenger to chat them up. If my friend is into making videos and such, I will talk with them on Youtube. I will cater to what they value and work with that. If they value art, I will talk through a medium that allows my friend to express their art.  If they value posting the latest political gossip and memes, then I will respect that and talk with them through Facebook which is a platform that better allows people to express that side of themselves.  The only obstacles in these situations would be perhaps not being able to fully express yourself and your emotions through these platforms. The use of emojis and texts speak don't always allow you to get your point across.  To remedy this, it's best to use the messenger features on Instagram, or Facebook, instead of trying to keep things short and concise through commenting and liking a post.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: Staying connected with friends is important to me. To accomplish this I need a medium for the connection to happen and a friend with which to be connected. There are possibly many candidate friends and many possible mediums, however a challenge may be that not every friend has ability to coordinate over any media. For example, friend Jim does not have a phone. This is a hurdle to many forms of communication and connection such as texting, social media apps, and simply a phone call. With that in mind, though, there are still over channels by which a connection can be made. So, after identifying Jim as my target friend, I must identify the media for connection. For Jim, I choose to write a letter and mail it. This medium for connection has sub steps associated with it. That includes first getting supplies (pen, paper, envelope stamps). Then writing the note to be the connection. Then the note is placed in the envelope which is addressed and stamped. It is then placed in the mail box. From here it is the responsibility of other entities in the delivery of the connection - many (if not most) forms of connection have some at least marginal reliance on third parties. When Jim receives my letter, the initial connection is complete - even though I may not know that it has happened. At this time it is now Jim's to determine if he should connect back or allow the connection to rest.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: Staying connected with friends at all times is essential to our well being, especially during times like now as we find ourselves in the midst of a global pandemic. But thankfully we have several platforms available that help make it easier to communicate with each other. Sources like social media apps that have audio and video calling features are probably one of the easiest and cheapest ways to talk and communicate with our friends. The old fashion way of using a telephone or the now more commonly used cellphone is the fastest and easiest method of talking with our friends. But sometimes this method may not be the most economical way, especially if the calls are made long distance when people stay in different countries. International calls tend to be more expensive and may not put at ease when we talk as we watch the clock ticking and the telephone bill increasing. So the best possible option could be using free video calling facilities available downloading free apps like Zoom, Google, Whatsapp or even Facetime. These apps provide fast, reliable and free calling facilities provided one has a reliable network or Wi-Fi connection available. But these apps surely make it easier for us to contact our friends and stay connected with them.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: In order to stay in contact with friends, I have two primary ways of doing so. The first is with my iPhone since I, and most of my friends, all use iphones so we have the iMessage ability and this is the most convenient way of getting a hold of each other. We will add each other to group threads so we can all talk in the same thread. If text is not working or I am unable to get a response from someone then sometimes I will use Facebook messenger as an alternative in order to get in touch. It is easy to see when someone is online and just like with text threads we can talk in group chats. Between these two messaging platforms we are usually always able to be in touch and it is very convenient in order to plan group activities or discuss things as a group or one on one if that is what we prefer at the time.

question: How do you stay connected with friends?
text: It can be hard to keep in touch with friends as an adult, with the responsibilities and obligations of adulthood getting in the way of relationships that once seemed effortless to maintain. People move, get careers, and start families, and priorities change with time. Social media helps greatly to stay connected with friends, but liking and commenting on posts is a far cry from socializing in person. But when distance prohibits us from connecting with our friends in person, technology is a fantastic tool for staying close with the people we care about. Taking the time to write a thoughtful message, and asking questions, goes a long way in helping us maintain our priceless friendships no matter how much distance separates us from them. It's important to keep an open dialogue and actually communicate through social media rather than just sharing emojis and likes. When we do actually find the time to see our friends in person, that communication on social media will make it seem like no time has passed at all.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: As a movie watcher, I first decide which streaming platform I want to use that night, I usually decide between Netflix or Hulu for finding a movie to watch. Then, I look through the categories of movie and choose one I like, for example, comedy or romance. After I select that category, I will then probably look through the movies and look at their Rotten Tomatoes score or User Rating. I usually will only consider ones with higher than a 50% or 3/5 because that usually indicates it's a better movie. Because I've been bored lately, I want something a little more fun and interesting to keep me interested, so I'll probably pick a funny movie with a high rating. If the ratings are bad, I'll move on to a different movie. I want to watch a movie that is interesting and that I thoroughly enjoy, so I could recommend to other people to watch too. Before I finally settle on a movie, I'll watch the trailer first to make sure it's seems like it's in my taste. Then, I'll finally select the movie I want to watch to occupy my time.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: First I open up Netflix to see what's available. Then I scroll through the recommendations to see if there's anything that seems interesting to me. I watch the short trailers provided by Netflix to get a general idea of what the movie is like. If I find something that I think I might  enjoy, I type the title of the movie into a search engine to quickly check some reviews while making sure that I don't click on any that have major spoilers in them. I want to make sure that I find a movie that will hold my attention all the way through, so I won't get bored and want to switch to something else in the middle. When I find a movie that seems interesting and that has decent reviews, I click play and maximize my browser so it's full screen. I prefer to watch movies alone and in a secluded place, so I make sure my door is shut and that the lights are off before the film begins.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: I typically focus first on the movie genre, as I prefer dramas or something with a historical theme. I search a movie database and look for something that has a good rating. I also tend to search for something that stars my favorite actor or actress. If something catches my eye I will search for reviews online and then make my decision. I want to find something that I know will be worth my time watching, and a combination of reviews by critics along with regular viewers helps me to make my choice. If I see something that has an overall bad review I remove it from the list of my potential choices. I want something that will grab my attention from the start and keep me interested until the final credits. If I am going to spend the money I want it to be money well spent, and good entertainment. I also want something that my family will enjoy as we will all be watching together, and it's important to choose something that will please everyone.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: I first think about what kind of movie I'm in the mood to watch. If I'm with other people, I would get their  opinions on the matter. I would want to be entertained if I was with others. I would look at the reviews for the different movies online that I would be thinking of on Rotten Tomatoes. I would then think about where I would watch the movie. I would most likely want to go to the theaters if I was with others so that we would be able to remember the experience. If I was picking a movie for myself, I would pick a movie that would allow me to stay at home so that I wouldn't feel like a loser. In any situation where I would stay at home, I would also need to own a subscription to a streaming service where I would be able to watch the movie.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: When selecting a movie to watch, I often go to a popular movie review sites such as Rotten Tomatoes which has reviews for all of the latest movies and more.  I then decide on the newest released titles that I may have heard of or that I know about and I have been looking forward to see.  If the movie I'm looking forward to ends up having a good to decent review, I would then go to a movie ticket site, such as Fandango, to look at ticket options and show times. However though, if the movie time doesn't fit my schedule, I may go back to step one and select another movie to see. Or if the tickets are beyond my budget (movies are expensive nowadays!), I may wait for a matinee price or may be wait till the movie is released on DVD.  Spending a day at the movies allows for me to get out of the house, be with friends and hopefully be entertained by the film.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: When I want to watch a movie the first thing I have to decide it whether I want to watch a movie in the theater or in my home.  Since movie theaters are restricted due to the pandemic and I have a goal of reducing social contact with groups of people I would choose to watch the movie at home.  My next step is to find a list of current movies that are available to rent or stream.  I have a bookmark of some aggregator sites that lists what each service is currently showing. I would browse this list to see if any movie catches my attention, usually I gravitate towards new releases as I find them more exciting than watching older movies.  I also tend to select movies that fit into the fantasy, sci-fi, or action genre.  I would browse the list to see which current movie catches my attention at that particular time, then I would find out where I could rent or watch the movie.  I tend to value movies that are free to watch through streaming services that I am currently subscribed to or movies that I can rent with a discount through a coupon code or promotion.  Finally, I evaluate how much I want to watch the movie vs. how much it costs and how willing I am to wait for the movie to come down in price or possibly go to a streaming service that I am subscribed to.  If I find that my desire to watch the movie outweighs the price I will then select the movie.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: So I don't have a particular method but rather there are a handful of things that I look for when I browse movies and decide what to watch. I first consider genre because sci-fi is my favorite genre and anything cyberpunk or futuristic is usually something I will enjoy. I start by browsing by newest releases to see if any sci-fi movies have come out lately, if I don't see anything that peaks my interest I move on to another category such as drama or a film by a director I like. For example, while looking for a sci-fi film to watch, I came across Tenet which is the perfect example of a film I enjoy. I will then check on the ratings or reviews to see what people are saying about it just in case it is not worth watching which is very rare. Once I see that there is at least a 6/10 stars on IMDB I will give the movie a chance. If the IMDB rating is less than 5.5 or so I will just skip the movie.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: As a movie watcher, I first select the genre of movie that I would want to watch, such as action, on the app. Then, I sort the movie results by highest ratings first. Then, I check some of the top movie results by looking at their titles and summaries, to help me decide which one of the movies I like the most. Because I do not have much time, I prefer short movies over long movies. I also look at the reviews of the movies to help me with my decision making. If the reviews for one of the movies are bad, I won't select that movie. I pay special attention to factors such as price, level of instruction, and level of reflection. I like instructional movies that cause me to reflect on them. I don't want to spend a lot of money on a movie since I am on a budget.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: Firstly, I try to find a list of movies that are in the genre that my wife and I like. We go through the list looking for horror movies that we have not seen yet. If a plot line that grabs our attention pops up, we will check the reviews. We want a movie that has at least decent reviews and also has a plot line that we both will enjoy (my wife does not like zombie horror, for example). Once we have singled it down to a handful of movies, we will typically just randomly select one. If the movie doesn't tickle our fancy in the first 10 minutes, we will go back to the list and make another selection. Eventually, we will reach our goal of finding a horror movie that we will both enjoy and will speak somewhat positively to others about. That's our process for selecting a film.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: To choose a movie to watch, I first ask myself what kind of mood am I in? If I am in a sad mood, then I will want to watch a comedy. If I'm happy, then maybe I'd still want to watch a comedy or could handle a scary movie. If I'm watching a comedy, then my goal is to laugh. So I will look through movie selections that have actors or scenarios that I would think would make me laugh. If my goal is to think deeply or feel scared, then I'll find a movie like a documentary or a horror movie, respectively.  I value being able to watch a movie by myself or with a significant other, so I'm likely not to watch a movie in a theater but rather rent a movie and watch it at home.  If for some reason the movie doesn't make me laugh within the first fifteen minutes, then i'll find a new movie to watch. And if the movie doesn't make me scared or think deeply within the same time frame, I will also find another movie to watch.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: There are many ways that one can choose a good movie to watch, but each person has their own unique way of doing this. My way is to first choose my top three movies that I am wanting to watch and lay them out side by side. Because I usually know what three movies I want to watch at a given time this method works for me. Once they are laid out side by side I turn them over and read the backs of the movies to remember the plot lines. When I have done this I look at the genre of movie and decide what kind of a mood I am in. This usually eliminates one of my choices and leaves me with only two choices left to choose from. The next thing I do is not very scientific, but it usually works well for me and I like it because it is gives me a sense of surprise. I always have my husband put the two remaining movies behind his back and then mix them up while I'm not watching. Then after he has mixed them up I choose a hand and he reveals the movie that I picked. That will be the movie that I will watch at that time. There are a few roadblocks when choosing a movie the way I do though. First of all, if I have all movies of the same genre picked that makes eliminating the first one more difficult and I will usually just have to have my husband hide the three movies behind his back and the first one I choose is the one I first eliminate. The other obstacle I sometimes face is when I want to watch a movie and my husband isn't home to hide them behind his back and let me choose I have to do to an "enie, meanie, minie, moe" rhyme to eliminate them one at a time. This may not be the most conventional way of choosing a movie, but I like it and has been working for me for years and to this point I haven't been disappointed with my choice.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: I first boot up Netflix to see if there are any new releases on the platform. Netflix usually has a top ten list of the programs that are the most watched on that day, so I'll take a look at that as well. Then, I narrow down movie picks to what genre I am currently in the mood for. I fancy myself a documentary movie fan so those movies usually catch my eye first. If I see no documentaries in the top ten list I'll go to Netflix's designated documentary movie section. I am also a history buff so I'll scan the results for historical documentaries. Once I narrow down my movie picks I do a quick Google search to read up on the film as well as read any available reviews. Rotten Tomatoes is a good resource in regards to reviews. Finally, I choose a documentary to watch, fire up some popcorn, and enjoy the film!

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: As a avid movie watcher, I like to stay up to date on what movies are coming out, so I will always be watching new trailers online to what is coming out soon and I will keep a note of what movies I am interested in watching. I will watch many trailers across many different genres even if I am not sure I will be interested in the movie or not. Then I will rank what movie I can't wait to see down to what movies I can watch on a slow day let's say. I will often read reviews on movies that are toward the bottom of my to-watch list as I'm not really sure if I want to invest my time in them or not whereas movies on the top of my list I tend to stay away from reviews as I like to go in with no preconceived ideas about the film. I love to watch movies at home as I have a nice setup and I can pause a movie without missing anything I can also eat or drink whatever I want so that is really enticing to me to try and save some money there as well as on the tickets.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text:
Mostly, it depends on my mood at the time. I like revisiting one's I've watched, but also occasionally like new movies. When I was laid up in the hospital I bought Bill and Ted Face The Music, and Jay and Silent Bob Reboot, but mostly I just stick with whatever I feel like watching. I absolutely cannot watch the Deadpool movies right now because I'm undergoing proton therapy for eye cancer and it's rough, emotionally, because I'm exhausted 80% of the day so when Wade just randomly passes out I know how it is.

I stick with mostly believable sci-fi and try to keep the explosions to a minimum since I'm in a hotel Monday through Friday on the hospital's dime and don't want people complaining about me and risk the hospital's direct billing status with the hotel.

When I'm at home though, all bets are off. Sci-fi nerd or not, and as much as I don't like Tom Cruise as a person, I LOVE the Jack Reacher books and the movies are almost verbatim to the books (except that Reacher is like 6'4" to Cruise's 5'7"). If a Jack Reacher movie is on PlutoTV, I'll watch it because Cruise actually pulls off Reacher's no-bullshit attitude.

But primarily, it's whatever I feel like watching at the time and what's available. At the hotel, I'm limited to basic cable or Hulu (if I hook my laptop to the TV) and at home it's Hulu/Netflix/PlutoTV/whatever my TV auto-updates its' apps to when I get back Friday afternoon and turn it on. It's just "Meh, whatever".

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: First, I decide which day and time I am going to watch the movie. As of right now, that's not really important anymore, since due to coronavirus the theaters are closed and even if they were open I would not go there. Then, I find out if I am going to see the movie by myself or with a group of friends or family. After I have that sorted out, I will decide which movie to watch, based on what's currently available. for example, i usually like movies with a lot of action, like superhero movies. I also like movies about thrillers or science fiction. As right now I'm watching movies from home, I usually take a look at the pay per view section of my cable operator, to see if there's a movie i would like to watch. I do this on saturday nights mostly, where i have the time. Then I rent the movie, which is usually around 6 bucks and I start to watch as soon as I have ordered it.

question: How do you choose a movie to watch?
text: First I have to decide which streaming service to choose. There are many different ones but I usually start off with Netflix because I like the interface better. Amazon is cool because they have more options but some cost money and I'd rather watch a free movie. If there is nothing good on Netflix I then checkout Amazon. Because I have kids who are usually always around, I have to find something suitable for all ages. So next I check out the movie recommendations section. If there is nothing there I like then I go to check out the kids and family movies. Movies aimed at preschoolers are pretty awful so I try to find a way to sort those out. From there the family and I try to find something we can agree on. It's always difficult with my six year old because she loves to watch the same movies over and over again.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When on a vacation, I usually need a hotel room to stay in because I don't have any friends or houses there. I will first look up on google "hotels near me" and open up the results. I will sort them by location, to see what's nearest. After that, I will look through at each individual one to check reviews, photos, and ratings. I'm interested in safety and comfort when staying at a hotel room, so I'll only stay at highly rated hotels near me. Probably 4/5 stars or more. I also want my room to be somewhat nice, with privacy and well cleaned. I don't want to feel like I'm staying in someone else's space. I'll also pay attention to price, as I can't afford to pay an extraordinary amount. To reserve a room, I would probably check the number given on the google result and call. Then, I'd ask to make a reservation for a single bedroom and give them my dates. I'd then walk to the hotel and stay there for the night.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When I need a hotel room, I first find a website that will show me multiple hotels available in the destination area. I then think about how far from the city center I want to stay. I prefer having a quiet evening, so I would want to stay farther away from areas with nightlife. I try to sort hotels by the amount the rooms cost per night. In general, I want to stay in an inexpensive hotel, but I do not want to stay in the lowest-cost because it might be a poor quality experience. I look at hotels that have amenities I like. Breakfast offerings or room service can make things much easier when I'm traveling. Also, a gym or pool is very convenient for exercise. Finally, I look at reviews of the hotels. I always choose a hotel with decent reviews that fits within my budget for the length of my stay.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When I am going to travel and need to pick a hotel room, I Google hotels in the area I plan on traveling to. Once the Google search brings up the hotels I filter what I want and what I do not want in a hotel. Depending on my budget,  I set the price range from $70-$300. I then set the star rating for 3 & up. I like to be close to shopping, restaurants and clean communities. I always travel with my family so I make sure I filter hotels that have double beds, an extra sleeper, pet friendly, with free WIFI, a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot. Hotels that serve a free breakfast are always a plus for everyone (especially families). I thoroughly read at least 30-80 reviews on each hotel to make sure in the end I have made the best choice. It is a plus if I am a member of the hotel chain, and if not I sign up to be a member for any one that I am interested in so I can earn discounts and points. After I am happy with the price, area, amenities and reviews I log into the hotel site select the days of my stay, from check in to check out, select my room choice and select payment and check out. My confirmation is instantly emailed to me and I am all set.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: The best way to choose a hotel room is to do some research first. There are several websites available that provide various options in terms of what one's preference is. Once the choice is narrowed down, it is advisable to compare 2 prices of similar rooms with other hotels. Always make sure the reservation is made in advance and the payment is also made. There can be occasions when someone may presume the room is booked, but if the upfront payment is not received by the hotel, the room may not be reserved in their name. It is also advisable to ensure that an email confirmation is received in order to show at the front desk upon arrival at the hotel. Different people have different preferences which is crucial to note when making the reservation. Especially when the room preferences relate to number of beds and the view from the hotel. Last but not least, it always helps to read reviews on the website. Previous travelers often give a fair and honest opinion and description of their experience. This helps in eliminating any disappointments and overpaying of charges.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: If I had to choose and reserve a hotel room, I would follow a number of steps. First I would do a broad search around the area where I was staying and identified all the hotels that I can stay at. Next, I would filter the hotels by their star level since I want to stay at a nice hotel. After selecting these criteria, I would further rank the hotels by their cost as that is an obstacle to me because I don't want to spend an exorbitant amount of money on lodging. After reducing the hotels to a price range that I find acceptable, I do more research on the areas around the hotel, I want to ensure that the place that I'm staying at is safe and is conveniently close to places that I want to visit because the whole point of reserving a hotel room is for me to able to travel. This should narrow down the hotels to a select few that meets all of my criteria. I would then read the reviews and look at the pictures of the hotels that made my final cut, out of these I would eliminate any hotels that had bad reviews or had pictures that did not meet my expectations]. I like hotels that are fancy, have cool and unique amenities and offer excellent services. After identifying the hotel that has the best mixture of reviews, amenities, service, and pictures I would further read their reservation policies. Here I would look at things like refund policies, cancelation fees, checkout times, and extra charges. If all of these are satisfactory I would then proceed to reserve the hotel online using the official hotel website.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: I choose a hotel room by first Googling deals and discounts online. I then narrow down the search results by filtering on my date range of the trip, the average star rating that the property has received, and by the attractiveness of any pictures posted by customers in their reviews. It's my goal to maximize the value of my purchase by getting a hotel room with maximum attractiveness and a high star rating, that won't break my bank as I am usually traveling on a budget. Sometimes I may hit a snag because a hotel room that I really love turns out to be way outside of my price range, or they don't have any rooms available for the dates that I want. After I've run my filters, I curate the list to just a couple of options and then look up the contact information for those properties. I find the phone number and then give their concierge or front desk staff a call. I will ask about any special amenities that the property might be offering for the dates of my trip, like free WiFi or a free continental breakfast. Then, I will choose which of the two hotels is the cheaper deal with more amenities. It is important to me that I book a hotel that handles requests efficiently and also provides a lot of amenities and perks for guests, as my comfort is a top priority whenever I am staying at a hotel. I will then reserve my room by giving my name and credit card information, as well as the dates of my planned stay, to the front desk staff on the phone.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When looking to book a hotel room, the first thing I need to know is what city I'm staying in and the dates I'll need to be there. Then, I lookup available rooms online and start to get a feel for my options. I like to look at the lowest priced rooms first, to get a good sense of the worst of what's available. Then, I look into the mid to upper level rooms, that may be my ideal choice, if budget wasn't a factor. Once I have an idea of what it will cost to stay there, I start to narrow down my options to a final 2 or 3 hotels. At this point, I need to check reviews to see if there are any major things I may want to know before staying there, and check and see if the location is reasonable for the places that I will be going to while staying there. I need to find a room that is within my budget, but also close enough to the locations I will be frequenting.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When I choose and reserve a hotel room, I first find the area where I need the hotel. Then I search for the hotels within a certain price range in that area. Once I find my price range, I filter them by ratings from highest to lowest. Since I want to be sure I get a good hotel at a great price, I make sure that the hotel I choose has a lot of reviewers so I can get a good idea of what to expect. Hotels with few reviewers and reviews go to the bottom of my list. I like to be sure that my hotel pick is favored by a lot of people, is in a good area or the area that I need, and is at a good and fair price. Some hotels may not be luxurious but they are great hotels as far as service, cleanliness, and location. I do not want to spend time in a hotel that has horrible service and is not clean.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: First, when I chose to find out what hotel I would like to stay at, I look for a lot of different aspects. Then I would find one that is cheap and affordable, while being in a good range of other aspects. Because I am trying to find it for cheap, I would look for good rated hotels that are fast and cheap. I like to have a big room so I would try to find that ratio with hotels. I want to save money with my range of options so I would try to use a filtering when I search. I also do not want to be paying over statements so I would find a good hotel with good management so I can try to save up on payment status. It will be good to know that I like to find the right room of a hotel search for my vacation or saving endeavors.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: As an avid traveler, I am always looking for a good hotel to stay in. First, I always look on a trip review site like Yelp or Trip Advisor and filter for hotels with high ratings. Then, I sort through the results based on filtering by location or based on landmark. Then I browse through traveler pictures to see what it looks like for real. After reading a few reviews, i will filter it down to one or two. Then once i've narrowed it down to the one that seems the best, i will browse pictures of rooms. I am looking for rooms that are comfortable and usually have good views, so i will then pick a room for that. I am looking to relax and decompress so I want to be able to look at a serene room.  If the pictures of the room look good, i will compare prices across sites to see the best one. If the prices are low on one site, I won't book the room on that site. I also won't book any rooms that have bad pictures.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: I stay in hotel rooms a lot, and I've always been disappointed for one reason or another for something, no stay has been perfect. First on my list of priorities is the location, I always start by entering the city and state I'm planning to visit, then I want to find a hotel room that is close to the attractions that I want to visit, like the museum, or the beach, bonus points if the hotel is located near several restaurants that I can just walk to. Next, I check to make sure there is a hot tub or a pool, I at least need a hot tub that is open until ten pm. Then I check to see the other amenities, like free parking, free breakfast, or if animals are allowed to stay. If the hotel is perfect in every way, but I can't bring my dog, then that is a deal breaker. I don't want to have to worry about my pup when I'm trying to enjoy myself. I also check the reviews, to make sure that it's not a terrible place to stay, I factor in the people who just had a miserable time because they have impossible standards, but I really pay attention to the reviews that talk about how well they were treated by the staff, if it's bad, then I tend to want to stay away. The price is also a factor, I don't want to pay more than two hundred dollars for a three star hotel per night. If it's in the three star range, I like it to be between one twenty and one fifty per night.  If pets are allowed, they are in the price range that I'm looking for, they have a hot tub, and it's near the attractions that I want to visit, then I book it. Not having a free breakfast is not a deal breaker and neither is not having free parking, but that parking better not cost too much. If no breakfast is served, a mini fridge and a microwave in the room is a must. Eating out at a restaurant for every meal is just crazy.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: First, decide where you want to travel, and what you want to do while there. Your hotel should be reasonably close to the places you want to visit during your stay. Access to transportation is crucial, and walkability is even better. It should go without saying that safety should be your number one concern, with convenience and comfort coming in second. Once you have a general area in mind, find a hotel that meets your needs, wants and budget. Call the hotels to compare rates and check availability. It's also useful to peruse Yelp and Trip Advisor to see what other guests' experiences have been; these can be great resources to gather information and make comparisons. When you have found the best option, reserve a room in advance. It's also good to find out what their refund and cancellation policy is in case of any last minute snafus. Once you've booked your stay, enjoy your visit!

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: I don't like to spend a lot of money, but I do appreciate a comfortable, home-like atmosphere. First, I go online and search for hotels in the area where I plan to stay. I eliminate all of the cheap "motels" that are unlikely to provide comfort, cleanliness, or privacy. Then I look at the reviews of the various hotels. If the hotel has lousy reviews, I eliminate it and make a short list of high-ranking hotels. I then start comparing them by balancing value and reviews. I don't like paying more than $90-100 / night, and I don't like resorts. If a hotel is too expensive, I take it off of the short list. Next, I look at the individual rooms that they provide and evaluate the layout and amenities. I prefer things such as a comfortable bed, comfortable seats, a mini-fridge, a quiet HVAC system, and blackout curtains. I don't put value into TVs and things like that. Once I find a well-priced room with lots of comfort and a good location, I go on the hotel website and use my credit card to reserve the room.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: In my many travels for business - at company expense - I had a very strict algorithm to finding a hotel room. It was always important for me to find a cost effective room that was respectful of the impact on the company budget. First, I would try to understand the physical layout of the area of town I was visiting. Maybe I would be going to a large city with many accommodations that are walking distance from the work offices. Sometimes I would find myself working in rural districts that require a drive to the work space. These factors in mind were always important when finding a hotel. Then I would filter the area based on what I discovered. A significant challenge is that - even in today's technological wonderland - not every site has map based search tools for locational review of hotel choices. When a site must be used without this feature a fix to the problem can be applied in the separate plotting of several choices on a Google Map. Finally, I would compare amenities with cost - should the appropriate amenities enable a more efficient stay (refrigerators instead of reliance on room service, for example), then the hotel would be selected. This supports the need for a hotel room and coordinates it with respect to the company budget.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: First I look up hotels in the area I need them in. I'll usually use travel rating websites for hotels. If there's filter option I'll organize them by price, maybe set a limit if possible. I'll look at images and see if they line up with what reviews and descriptions claim. Bad reviews definitely make me look elsewhere. Once I find one that has a decent enough balance between price and rating, I start looking at rooms. I consider how much space I'll need. If it's just me I'll consider amenities offered (cable, wifi, breakfast, etc..). I don't care too much about stuff like nice views and pools, I'm more concerned over whether the rooms comfy and trying to find out if there are any common service or sanitary issues. Once I have a room selected I'll check if I can reserve it online. I prefer to do it online but I don't mind calling in if I have to.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: The process I use to find a hotel to reserve begins with Google. I will usually start by putting the destination or city that I plan to stay in and the word "hotel" to see which hotels are available. Once I find a hotel that I am familiar with, I will begin doing some basic checks such as star rating and Google reviews. I will then go to the hotel's actual website and see if they have online booking. Sometimes I will also check a third party site such as Tripadvisor to see what kind of deals they have. If there is no deal or discount by booking through a third party I will return to the hotel website to book through them directly. If they don't have a way to book online on the website, I'll find the hotel's phone number and call them to make the reservation that way. As long as the hotel is clean looking and I can see a photo of the actual rooms and they look appealing I will complete the booking process.

question: How do you choose and reserve a hotel room?
text: When choosing a hotel, I type in the city I wish to stay in on the hotel app on my phone. I sort the hotels according to star rating and choose a hotel in my price range. It's nice when there are several hotels available so I can find one that fits my needs the best. If the hotel doesn't have a swimming pool I take that hotel off my list of possibilities . Once I find a hotel in my price range that has a swimming pool, I read some of the online reviews about the hotel to make sure other people enjoyed their stay at the hotel. I look through the available photos of the hotel so I know what to expect. It is a definitely a bonus if the hotel has a free breakfast and free parking. I will usually see which hotel in my price range has the best amenities and best location. Once I decide which hotel fits my needs the best, I check to see if the hotel has rooms available for the date of my stay. If it has no dates available I try the next best hotel. Once I find a hotel with rooms available I make my reservation.
